intro: Volutaria crupinoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Volutaria crupinoides is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
